text: there's this amazing bar in the middle
of the desert it's off the map and off
the grid and it's not easy to find the
Nelly is buried deep in the Buckskin
mountains on an old mining camp there's
two ways to get here however the back
way the way we got here should be the
only way this locale is for the curious
it's a secluded destination powered by
the Sun and cooled by towers the bar
windows are made of old refrigerator
doors the stools are welded by hand and
there's the church if it doesn't hold
services it's only open on weekends from
noon to sunset it's eclectic fascinating
and loaded with character they only
accept cash and to say that the menu is
simple would be an understatement but
you don't come here for the food or even
the beer come for the live music or the
recycled art just make sure you come in
four-wheel drive it's an adventure
getting out here but it's well worth the
trip
you
